c74object.name: bach.score2roll
c74object.digest: Convert a bach.score into a bach.roll
c74object.description: Converts a bach.score object into a bach.roll object containing the exact same content, only in proportional notation, also preserving markers.

inlet.digest: The llll obtained from bach.score's first outlet when sending a score2roll message

outlet.digest: The llll containing the gathered syntax of the converted bach.roll

method.name: bang
method.description: Performs the conversion on the most recently received input llll.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Convert and output bach.roll gathered syntax
method.description: An llll in the first inlet is considered as the llll obtained in the first outlet of a bach.score when a score2roll message is sent: the content of the bach.score is thus converted into the gathered syntax of a bach.roll having the same content (only in proportional notation). Such gathered syntax is output from the outlet, ready to be connected with the left inlet of a bach.roll.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

c74object.discussion: The inverse task is less immediate and is performed via bach.quantize.
